parsedLessonPreview: {"id":"egy_marriage_proposal_01","title":{"arabic":"طلب إيد العروسة","english":"Asking for the Bride's Hand","transliteration":"Talab Ed El Arousa"},"level":"beginner","description":{"arabic":"تعلم الجمل الأساسية والآداب لزيارة طلب الزواج في مصر","english":"Learn the essential phrases and cultural etiquette for the traditional Egyptian marriage proposal meeting, known as 'Arayet Fatha'."},"learningObjectives":["How to greet the bride's family formally","The specific phrase used to propose","Key family vocabulary (groom, bride, daughter)","Cultural responses to congratulations"],"estimatedDuration":25,"prerequisites":["Basic greetings","Introduction to pronouns"],"subLessons":[{"id":"sub_01_the_visit","title":{"arabic":"الزيارة والترحيب","english":"The Visit and Welcome","transliteration":"El Ziyara Wel Tarhib"},"content":{"title":{"arabic":"كلمات الزيارة","english":"Visit Vocabulary","transliteration":"Kalimat El Ziyara"},"phrases":[{"arabic":"احنا جايين...","english":"We are coming...","transliteration":"Ehna gayin..."},{"arabic":"نتشرف بيكم","english":"We are honored to meet you","transliteration":"Netsharraf bikom"},{"arabic":"عريس","english":"Groom","transliteration":"Arous"},{"arabic":"عروسة","english":"Bride","transliteration":"Arousa"},{"arabic":"يا حاج / يا طنط","english":"Hajj (Respectful title for elder man) / Tant (Auntie/Respectful title for elder woman)","transliteration":"Ya Hajj / Ya Tant"},{"arabic":"نشرب شاي","english":"We drink tea","transliteration":"Neshrab shay"}],"explanations":[{"english":"In Egypt, when the groom's family visits, they usually say 'Ehna gayin' (We are coming) followed by the reason. The groom is called 'Arous' and the bride 'Arousa'."}]},"exercises":[{"id":"ex_01_vocab_match","type":"matching","question":{"english":"Match the Arabic word to its English meaning.","arabic":"وصل الكلمة بمعناها"},"options":[{"arabic":"عريس","english":"Groom","transliteration":"Arous","isCorrect":true},{"arabic":"عروسة","english":"Bride","translite
